title: How to Use a Pacifier Clip: Secure Pacifiers, Sippy Cups & More

steps.title: Push the end of the loop through the handle of the pacifier.
steps.content: Push the end of the loop through the handle of the pacifier. Locate the handle or ring on the outside of the pacifier, which is where you want to attach the pacifier clip . Squeeze the end of the loop to make it smaller and then push it through the handle. Pull the loop out on the other side of the handle until the edge of the pacifier is up against the strap. [1] X Research source The loop is often made from a thick material, such as leather, cord, or canvas. Warning: Do not pull the loop through the small holes in the pacifier, as this can be a safety hazard. These are ventilation holes that give your baby access to air in the very rare case they swallow their pacifier. So, obstructing the holes can be a choking risk. [2] X Trustworthy Source Consumer Reports Nonprofit organization dedicated to consumer advocacy and product testing Go to source

steps.title: Insert the end of the clip’s strap through the loop.
steps.content: Insert the end of the clip’s strap through the loop. Next, bring the clip end of the pacifier strap around and through the loop. Insert the clip and strap through the loop. [3] X Research source The strap may be a flat ribbon, or it might have beads or other decorative items on it. However, it should still fit through the loop easily.

steps.title: Pull to tighten the loop around the pacifier.
steps.content: Pull to tighten the loop around the pacifier. Tug on the strap until the loop tightens around the pacifier’s handle. This will secure the pacifier clip to the pacifier—it is now ready to use! [4] X Research source To remove the clip, simply pull on the knot to loosen the loop. Then, pull the handle back through the loop.

steps.title: Undo the snap at the end of the strap.
steps.content: Undo the snap at the end of the strap. Locate the snap and use your fingers to pry it open. Pull it apart so that the end of the strap is accessible. [5] X Research source If the strap uses Velcro, then use your fingers to pull apart the Velcro.

steps.title: Slip the strap through the handle of the pacifier.
steps.content: Slip the strap through the handle of the pacifier. Locate the handle or ring on the outside of the pacifier. Insert the strap through the handle with the snap facing out and away from the nipple of the pacifier. [6] X Research source If the strap uses Velcro to secure itself, then make sure the Velcro is facing away from the nipple.

steps.title: Press the snaps together to secure the clip.
steps.content: Press the snaps together to secure the clip. Line up the snap pieces on the other side of the pacifier handle. Then, press them together again to secure the strap to the pacifier. [8] X Research source If the strap uses Velcro, press the Velcro together to secure the strap. To remove the clip, simply pull the snap or Velcro apart again.

steps.title: Squeeze the clip to open it up.
steps.content: Squeeze the clip to open it up. The clip part of a pacifier clip is at the opposite end of the strap where you attached the pacifier. Locate it and squeeze the handles on the clip to open it. [9] X Research source For some types of clips , you flip a plastic piece on the clip to open it up. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Find an unobtrusive spot low on your child’s clothing and pinch it.
steps.content: Find an unobtrusive spot low on your child’s clothing and pinch it. A good place is towards the bottom of your child’s shirt or sleeve of their onesie. This is also often where fabric is doubled up on onesies, so it may be a more secure place to attach the clip. Use your fingers to grasp a piece of the clothing where you want to attach the clip. [11] X Research source The clip is probably too strong for your child to undo, but it’s still a good idea to attach it somewhere they won’t be as tempted to mess with it. Warning: Do not place the clip close to your child’s neck. While the straps are kept short to prevent the risk of strangulation, there is a chance they could get wrapped around your child’s neck if placed higher up on their body.

steps.title: Slip a piece of your child’s clothing into the open clip and close it.
steps.content: Slip a piece of your child’s clothing into the open clip and close it. Continue to hold onto the clothing with 1 hand and the open clip with the other hand. Slide the clothing piece into the clip and then release the handles to close the clip around the clothing. [12] X Research source Warning: Be extra careful not to pinch any of your child’s skin or hair in the clip when you attach it.

steps.title: Secure the pacifier clip to your baby’s stroller or diaper bag.
steps.content: Secure the pacifier clip to your baby’s stroller or diaper bag. Feel free to secure the pacifier clip to other objects besides your child’s clothing to easily keep track of their pacifier. For instance, clip the pacifier onto your stroller, diaper bag, purse, or even your own clothes.

steps.title: Attach the clip to sippy cups or snack containers instead of a pacifier.
steps.content: Attach the clip to sippy cups or snack containers instead of a pacifier. Most pacifier clips easily attach to other objects that have handles, holes, or openings. So, use the clip to keep your child’s other items easily accessible. For instance, loop the clip through sippy cups, snack containers, teething rings, toys, and even blankets. Don’t attach these items to your child’s clothing, as they’re much heavier than a pacifier. Instead, secure them to your child’s stroller, diaper bag, or your own clothes.
